alert.note: Alert for Oahu in Honolulu (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 30 at 9:52PM HST until December 30 at 11:30PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF OAHU IN HONOLULU COUNTY... At 952 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain up to 2 inches per hour continuing over the portions of the Koolau mountains. While some of the rain is beginning to subside, additional rain is possible. Many area streams such as the Punaluu, Kahana, Waikane, Waiahole, Waihee and Heeia streams remain elevated. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Waikane, Waiahole, Mililani, Wahiawa, Kahaluu, Pearl City, Ahuimanu, Aiea, Halawa, Moanalua, Kaneohe, Kalihi, Haleiwa, Maunawili, Manoa, Kailua, Waimanalo, Kahana Valley State Park, Whitmore Village and Helemano Housing. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
